page.title: 18Silverburn Estate.
page.content: Silverburn is an estate owned and run by Kirkcaldy District Council and is open to the public. It is located to the east of Leven,near the sea and is set among woodland,some exotic, including Californian Redwood or Sequoia, which is about 100 years old. Five people work there all the time but others are also brought in.They look after the gardens and the animals and deal with the 56 or so organised trips every year. The staff are starting some organised studies but many of the people who come to Silverburn just come to walk round looking at the plants and animals or have picnics. Many rare breeds of ducks and hens can be seen.There are 18 rabbits,Ruby the cow,4 Vietnamese pigs,geese,ponies,Sugar the donkey and a horse called Big Ginger. OPENING TIMES:10.00-20.00(summer).
